children.subject: Completely depends on what you want to do. If you might want to go to grad school that should more heavily weight doing research, but otherwise I'd try to find an internship.

Personally, I would do summer classes. It's hard to find internships as a freshman but most ppl do theirs after sophomore year anyways (its gets easier once you're older to find an internship). I did summer classes during my freshman year summer and now have an internship offer for my sophomore spring and summer.

There's no rush to graduate (unless its for financial reasons). Use these four years to get everything out of the prolific program that is UC Berkeley EE/CS. If you feel that the internship may be a valuable opportunity of growth, do that. If you feel the classes are more important, then do that instead.

Hey just had a quick question. How were you able to get involved in research the summer of Freshman year? Is URAP even offered in summer? Do you have any advice to a freshman trying to get involved with research either in Spring or Summer?

Hey! I wouldn't start freaking out just yet - a lot of bigger companies wind down their recruiting season at this time, but by no means is it impossible to find an internship, and IIRC summer enrollment hasn't opened. I would suggest looking around at the startup fair in spring semester.

If you don't have something in the works by March or so, you might want to start looking at your other options. I did research + CS 70 the summer after my freshman year and it definitely let me get ahead on courses I was interested in. If you're looking for a research position around then, I would recommend talking to your GSIs or emailing grad students in relevant groups (PIs can be very busy and hard to reach sometimes).

As I mentioned earlier, you're by no means out of luck on the internship hunt, but you have plenty of other good options, and you don't have to rule out an internship just yet if that's what you want to do. Good luck!
Is this a satire post? Those all seem like amazing options.

history.content:
Hi, I am a freshman (intended) Computer Science student. Assuming I do end up declaring, I have plans to graduate in 3 years.

My internship search for this summer has not been going well so far. My options at this point look like this:

  • Go back to my high school internship at Hewlett Packard Enterprise
  • Find a startup internship
  • Do an upper division class/research during the summer (which will potentially allow me to graduate in 2.5 years instead)

I feel frantic about deciding between these 3 and I'm not sure what to do at all. Any advice?
history.subject: Summer 2020 - Startup Internship or Summer Classes
